entries.name: FORMAT
entries.desc: Default format string, see also Benchmark::FORMAT

entries.name: total
entries.desc: Total time, that is utime + stime + cutime + cstime

entries.name: new(utime = 0.0, stime = 0.0, cutime = 0.0, cstime = 0.0, real = 0.0, label = nil)
entries.desc: Returns an initialized Tms object which has utime as the user CPU time, stime as the system CPU time, cutime as the children's user CPU time, cstime as the children's system CPU time, real as the elapsed real time and label as the label.

entries.name: *(x)
entries.desc: Returns a new Tms object obtained by memberwise multiplication of the individual times for this Tms object by x.

entries.name: +(other)
entries.desc: Returns a new Tms object obtained by memberwise summation of the individual times for this Tms object with those of the other Tms object. This method and #/() are useful for taking statistics.

entries.name: -(other)
entries.desc: Returns a new Tms object obtained by memberwise subtraction of the individual times for the other Tms object from those of this Tms object.

entries.name: /(x)
entries.desc: Returns a new Tms object obtained by memberwise division of the individual times for this Tms object by x. This method and #+() are useful for taking statistics.

entries.name: add()
entries.desc: Returns a new Tms object whose times are the sum of the times for this Tms object, plus the time required to execute the code block (blk).

entries.name: add!(&blk)
entries.desc: An in-place version of add. Changes the times of this Tms object by making it the sum of the times for this Tms object, plus the time required to execute the code block (blk).

entries.name: format(format = nil, *args)
entries.desc: Returns the contents of this Tms object as a formatted string, according to a format string like that passed to Kernel.format. In addition, format accepts the following extensions:

entries.name: to_a()
entries.desc: Returns a new 6-element array, consisting of the label, user CPU time, system CPU time, children's user CPU time, children's system CPU time and elapsed real time.
